title: A Randomized Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled  Study of AST-611 (anti-IL-5 antibody) in Patients With Irritable Bowel Syndrome
officialTitle: A Randomized Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled  Study of AST-611 (anti-IL-5 antibody) in Patients With Irritable Bowel Syndrome
description: This is a randomized double-blind, placebo-controlled  study designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of AST-611 (anti-IL-5 antibody) in patients with Irritable Bowel Syndrome. The study will enroll approximately 329 patients.
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 21-56 years
- Confirmed diagnosis of Irritable Bowel Syndrome
- ECOG performance status 0-1
- Adequate organ function
- Willing and able to provide informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to study drug or excipients
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Participation in another interventional study within 30 days
- Significant cardiovascular disease within past 6 months
- Active or chronic infection requiring systemic treatment
